# utils.williams_transform { #pyLHD.utils.williams_transform }

`utils.williams_transform(arr, baseline=1)`

Williams Transformation

## Parameters

| Name       | Type          | Description                                                                              | Default    |
|------------|---------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `arr`      | numpy.ndarray | A design matrix                                                                          | _required_ |
| `baseline` | int           | A integer, which defines the minimum value for each column of the matrix. Defaults to 1. | `1`        |

## Returns

| Type          | Description                                                                               |
|---------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| npt.ArrayLike | After applying Williams transformation, a matrix whose sizes are the same as input matrix |

## Examples



```{python}
import pyLHD
random_lhd = pyLHD.random_lhd(n_rows=5,n_columns=3)
random_lhd
```
Change the baseline
```{python}
pyLHD.williams_transform(random_lhd,baseline=3)
```
